member.name: T:Volatile.FP
member.summary: Represents a Q31.32 fixed-point number.

member.name: F:Volatile.FP.Pi
member.summary: The value of Pi

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Sign(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns a number indicating the sign of a Fix64 number. Returns 1 if the value is positive, 0 if is 0, and -1 if it is negative.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Abs(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of a Fix64 number. Note: Abs(Fix64.MinValue) == Fix64.MaxValue.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.FastAbs(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of a Fix64 number. FastAbs(Fix64.MinValue) is undefined.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Floor(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the specified number.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Ceiling(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns the smallest integral value that is greater than or equal to the specified number.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Round(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Rounds a value to the nearest integral value. If the value is halfway between an even and an uneven value, returns the even value.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.op_Addition(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Adds x and y. Performs saturating addition, i.e. in case of overflow, rounds to MinValue or MaxValue depending on sign of operands.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.OverflowAdd(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Adds x and y performing overflow checking. Should be inlined by the CLR.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.FastAdd(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Adds x and y witout performing overflow checking. Should be inlined by the CLR.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.op_Subtraction(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Subtracts y from x. Performs saturating substraction, i.e. in case of overflow, rounds to MinValue or MaxValue depending on sign of operands.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.OverflowSub(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Subtracts y from x witout performing overflow checking. Should be inlined by the CLR.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.FastSub(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Subtracts y from x witout performing overflow checking. Should be inlined by the CLR.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.OverflowMul(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Performs multiplication without checking for overflow. Useful for performance-critical code where the values are guaranteed not to cause overflow

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.FastMul(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Performs multiplication without checking for overflow. Useful for performance-critical code where the values are guaranteed not to cause overflow

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.FastMod(Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Performs modulo as fast as possible; throws if x == MinValue and y == -1. Use the operator (%) for a more reliable but slower modulo.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Sqrt(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns the square root of a specified number.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Sin(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns the Sine of x. This function has about 9 decimals of accuracy for small values of x. It may lose accuracy as the value of x grows. Performance: about 25% slower than Math.Sin() in x64, and 200% slower in x86.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.FastSin(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns a rough approximation of the Sine of x. This is at least 3 times faster than Sin() on x86 and slightly faster than Math.Sin(), however its accuracy is limited to 4-5 decimals, for small enough values of x.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Cos(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns the cosine of x. See Sin() for more details.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.FastCos(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns a rough approximation of the cosine of x. See FastSin for more details.

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.Tan(Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Returns the tangent of x.
member.remarks: This function is not well-tested. It may be wildly inaccurate.

member.name: P:Volatile.FP.RawValue
member.summary: The underlying integer representation

member.name: M:Volatile.FP.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: This is the constructor from raw value; it can only be used interally.

member.summary: PI constant.

member.summary: Gets the maximum number of two values.

member.summary: Returns the cosine of value.

member.summary: Returns the arc tan of value.

member.summary: Returns the arc tan of coordinates x-y.

member.summary: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the specified number.

members.member: @brief Rotates a {@link TSVector} by the {@link TSQuanternion}.
@brief Generates random numbers based on a deterministic approach.
@brief Static instance of {@link TSRandom} with seed 1.
@brief Generates a new instance based on a given seed.
@brief Returns a integer between a min value [inclusive] and a max value [exclusive].
@brief Returns a {@link FP} between a min value [inclusive] and a max value [inclusive].
@brief Returns a integer between a min value [inclusive] and a max value [exclusive].
@brief Returns a {@link FP} between a min value [inclusive] and a max value [inclusive].
@brief Returns a random {@link TSVector} representing a point inside a sphere with radius 1.

member.name: T:Volatile.TSVector
member.summary: A vector structure.

member.summary: The X component of the vector.

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.y
member.summary: The Y component of the vector.

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.z
member.summary: The Z component of the vector.

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.zero
member.summary: A vector with components (0,0,0);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.left
member.summary: A vector with components (-1,0,0);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.right
member.summary: A vector with components (1,0,0);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.up
member.summary: A vector with components (0,1,0);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.down
member.summary: A vector with components (0,-1,0);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.back
member.summary: A vector with components (0,0,-1);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.forward
member.summary: A vector with components (0,0,1);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.one
member.summary: A vector with components (1,1,1);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.MinValue
member.summary: A vector with components (FP.MinValue,FP.MinValue,FP.MinValue);

member.name: F:Volatile.TSVector.MaxValue
member.summary: A vector with components (FP.MaxValue,FP.MaxValue,FP.MaxValue);

member.returns: Returns the length of the vector.

member.summary: Fixed update delta time for body integration. Defaults to Config.DEFAULT_DELTA_TIME.

member.summary: Adds a body to the world. Used for reintroducing bodies that have been removed. For new bodies, use CreateBody.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.RemoveBody(Volatile.VoltBody)
member.summary: Removes a body from the world. The body will be partially reset so it can be added later. The pointer is still valid and the body can be returned to the world using AddBody.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.DestroyBody(Volatile.VoltBody)
member.summary: Removes a body from the world and deallocates it. The pointer is invalid after this point.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.Update
member.summary: Ticks the world, updating all dynamic bodies and resolving collisions. If a frame number is provided, all dynamic bodies will store their state for that frame for later testing.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.Update(Volatile.VoltBody,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Updates a single body, resolving only collisions with that body. If a frame number is provided, all dynamic bodies will store their state for that frame for later testing.
Note: This function is best used with dynamic collisions disabled, otherwise you might get symmetric duplicates on collisions.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.QueryPoint(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.VoltBodyFilter,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Finds all bodies containing a given point.
Subsequent calls to other Query functions (Point, Circle, Bounds) will invalidate the resulting enumeration from this function.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.QueryCircle(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP,Volatile.VoltBodyFilter,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Finds all bodies intersecting with a given circle.
Subsequent calls to other Query functions (Point, Circle, Bounds) will invalidate the resulting enumeration from this function.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.RayCast(Volatile.VoltRayCast@,Volatile.VoltRayResult@,Volatile.VoltBodyFilter,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a raycast on all world bodies.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.CircleCast(Volatile.VoltRayCast@,Volatile.FP,Volatile.VoltRayResult@,Volatile.VoltBodyFilter,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a circle cast on all world bodies.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.BroadPhase
member.summary: Identifies collisions for all bodies, ignoring symmetrical duplicates.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.BroadPhase(Volatile.VoltBody,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Identifies collisions for a single body. Does not keep track of symmetrical duplicates (they could be counted twice).

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltWorld.NarrowPhase(Volatile.VoltShape,Volatile.VoltShape)
member.summary: Creates a manifold for two shapes if they collide.

member.name: T:Volatile.Axis
member.summary:
The Axis data structure represents a "slab" between the given edge and a parallel edge drawn at the origin. The "width" value gives the width of that axis slab, defined as follows: For an edge AB with normal N, this width w is given by Dot(A, N). If you take edge AB, and draw an edge CD parallel to AB that intersects the origin, the width w is equal to the minimum distance between edges AB and CD.
| | C | / | / A | / / | / / |/ w / -----------+---------/---- /| / D | / | / | B |

member.name: T:Volatile.TreeBroadphase
member.summary:
A dynamic tree bounding volume hierarchy used for collision detection. Does not support raycasts (for now) as they would not be compatible with Volatile's historical raycast capability -- no past-step data is preserved in this tree.
Bounding AABBs are expanded to allow for movement room according to the VoltConfig.AABB_EXTENSION setting.
Nodes are pooled and relocatable, so we use node indices rather than pointers.

member.name: T:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.Node
member.summary: A node in the dynamic tree.

member.name: F:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.Node.aabb
member.summary: Expanded AABB.

member.name: P:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.Height
member.summary: Compute the height of the binary tree in O(N) time. Should not be called often.

member.name: P:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.AreaRatio
member.summary: Get the ratio of the sum of the node areas to the root area.

member.name: P:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.MaxBalance
member.summary: Get the maximum balance of an node in the tree. The balance is the difference in height of the two children of a node.

member.name: M:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.ComputeHeight
member.summary: Compute the height of the entire tree.

member.name: M:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.AddBody(Volatile.VoltBody)
member.summary: Adds a body to the tree.

member.name: M:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.RemoveBody(Volatile.VoltBody)
member.summary: Removes a body from the tree.

member.name: M:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.UpdateBody(Volatile.VoltBody)
member.summary: Updates a body's position. If the body has moved outside of its expanded AABB, then the body is removed from the tree and re-inserted. Otherwise the function returns immediately.

member.name: M:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.ExpandChild(System.Int32,Volatile.VoltBuffer{Volatile.VoltBody})
member.summary: If the node is a leaf, we do not test the actual proxy bounding box. This is redundant since we will be testing the body's bounding box in the first step of the narrowphase, and the two are almost equivalent.

member.name: M:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.Balance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform a left or right rotation if node A is imbalanced.

member.name: M:Volatile.TreeBroadphase.ComputeHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compute the height of a sub-tree.

member.name: T:Volatile.CheapList`1
member.summary: A very loose partial encapsulation of a list array. Supports fast item at end, and fast arbitrary element removal. Does not guarantee order.

member.name: M:Volatile.CheapList`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Adds a new element to the end of the list. Returns the index of the newly-indexed object.

member.name: M:Volatile.CheapList`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes the element by swapping it for the last element in the list.

member.name: M:Volatile.Collision.TestPointCircleSimple(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Simple check for point-circle containment.

member.name: M:Volatile.Collision.TestCircleCircleSimple(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Simple check for two overlapping circles.

member.name: M:Volatile.Collision.CircleRayCast(Volatile.VoltShape,Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP,Volatile.VoltRayCast@,Volatile.VoltRayResult@)
member.summary: Checks a ray against a circle with a given origin and square radius.

member.name: M:Volatile.Collision.FindAxisShortestDistance(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.Axis[],Volatile.FP@)
member.summary: Returns the index of the nearest axis on the poly to a point. Outputs the minimum distance between the axis and the point.

member.name: M:Volatile.Collision.FindAxisMaxPenetration(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP,Volatile.VoltPolygon,Volatile.FP@)
member.summary: Returns the index of the axis with the max circle penetration depth. Breaks out if a separating axis is found between the two shapes. Outputs the penetration depth of the circle in the axis (if any).

member.name: M:Volatile.Collision.TestCircles(Volatile.VoltWorld,Volatile.VoltCircle,Volatile.VoltShape,Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Workhorse for circle-circle collisions, compares origin distance to the sum of the two circles' radii, returns a Manifold.

member.name: M:Volatile.Collision.FindVerts(Volatile.VoltPolygon,Volatile.VoltPolygon,Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP,Volatile.Manifold)
member.summary:
Add contacts for penetrating vertices. Note that this does not handle cases where an overlap was detected, but no vertices fall inside the opposing polygon (like a Star of David). For this we have a fallback.
See http://chipmunk-physics.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/src/cpCollision.c

member.name: M:Volatile.Collision.FindVertsFallback(Volatile.VoltPolygon,Volatile.VoltPolygon,Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP,Volatile.Manifold)
member.summary: A fallback for handling degenerate "Star of David" cases.

member.name: M:Volatile.HistoryBuffer.Store(Volatile.HistoryRecord)
member.summary: Stores a value as latest.

member.name: M:Volatile.HistoryBuffer.TryGet(System.Int32,Volatile.HistoryRecord@)
member.summary: Tries to get a value with a given number of frames behind the last value stored. If the value can't be found, this function will find the closest and return false, indicating a clamp.

member.name: M:Volatile.HistoryBuffer.GetValues
member.summary: Returns all values, but not in order.

member.name: T:Volatile.HistoryRecord
member.summary: A stored historical image of a past body state, used for historical queries and raycasts. Rather than actually rolling the body back to its old position (expensive), we transform the ray into the body's local space based on the body's old position/axis. Then all casts on shapes use the local-space ray (this applies both for current- time and past-time raycasts and point queries).

member.name: T:Volatile.VoltRayCast
member.summary: A semi-precomputed ray optimized for fast AABB tests.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltPolygon.GetEdge(System.Int32,Volatile.TSVector2@,Volatile.TSVector2@)
member.summary: Gets the vertices defining an edge of the polygon.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltPolygon.GetWorldAxis(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the axis at the given index.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltPolygon.ContainsPoint(Volatile.TSVector2)
member.summary: A world-space point query, used as a shortcut in collision tests.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltPolygon.ContainsPointPartial(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.TSVector2)
member.summary: Special case that ignores axes pointing away from the normal.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltAABB.RayCast(Volatile.VoltRayCast@,Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: A cheap ray test that requires some precomputed information. Adapted from: http://www.cs.utah.edu/~awilliam/box/box.pdf

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltAABB.QueryPoint(Volatile.TSVector2)
member.summary: Performs a point test on the AABB.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltAABB.QueryCircleApprox(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Note: This doesn't take rounded edges into account.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltAABB.CircleCastApprox(Volatile.VoltRayCast@,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Note: This doesn't take rounded edges into account.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.DisallowDynamic(Volatile.VoltBody,Volatile.VoltBody)
member.summary: A predefined filter that disallows collisions between dynamic bodies.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.TryGetSpace(System.Int32,Volatile.TSVector2@,Volatile.TSVector2@)
member.summary: Tries to get a reference frame for a given number of ticks behind the current tick. Returns true if a value was found, false if a value was not found (in which case we clamp to the nearest).

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.AssignHistory(Volatile.HistoryBuffer)
member.summary: Initializes the buffer for storing past body states/spaces.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.StoreState
member.summary: Stores a snapshot of this body's current state/space to a tick.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.GetState(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a snapshot of the body's state/space at a tick. Logs an error and defaults to the current state if it can't be found.

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltBody.IsStatic
member.summary: Static objects are considered to have infinite mass and cannot move.

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltBody.IsInWorld
member.summary: If we're doing historical queries or tests, the body may have since been removed from the world.

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltBody.UserData
member.summary: For attaching arbitrary data to this body.

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltBody.Angle
member.summary: Current angle in radians.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.QueryAABBOnly(Volatile.VoltAABB,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if an AABB overlaps with our AABB.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.QueryPoint(Volatile.TSVector2,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if a point is contained in this body. Begins with AABB checks unless bypassed.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.QueryCircle(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if a circle overlaps with this body. Begins with AABB checks.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.RayCast(Volatile.VoltRayCast@,Volatile.VoltRayResult@,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a ray cast check on this body. Begins with AABB checks.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.CircleCast(Volatile.VoltRayCast@,Volatile.FP,Volatile.VoltRayResult@,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a circle cast check on this body. Begins with AABB checks.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.PartialReset
member.summary: Used for saving the body as part of another structure. The body will retain all geometry data and associated metrics, but its position, velocity, forces, and all related history will be cleared.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.Reset
member.summary: Full reset. Clears out all data for pooling. Call FreeShapes() first.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.OnPositionUpdated
member.summary: Applies the current position and angle to shapes and the AABB.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.UpdateAABB
member.summary: Builds the AABB by combining all the shape AABBs.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBody.Integrate
member.summary: Computes forces and dynamics and applies them to position and angle.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltBuffer`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Adds a new element to the end of the list. Returns the index of the newly-indexed object.

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltShape.UserData
member.summary: For attaching arbitrary data to this shape.

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltShape.AABB
member.summary: The world-space bounding AABB for this shape.

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltShape.Area
member.summary: Total area of the shape.

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltShape.Mass
member.summary: Total mass of the shape (area * density).

member.name: P:Volatile.VoltShape.Inertia
member.summary: Total inertia of the shape relative to the body's origin.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltShape.QueryPoint(Volatile.TSVector2)
member.summary: Checks if a point is contained in this shape. Begins with an AABB check.

member.name: M:Volatile.VoltShape.QueryCircle(Volatile.TSVector2,Volatile.FP)
member.summary: Checks if a circle overlaps with this shape. Begins with an AABB check.

member.summary: Performs a raycast check on this shape. Begins with an AABB check.

member.summary: Performs a circlecast check on this shape. Begins with an AABB check.
